name: idler
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who is lazy and does not want to work or make any physical effort: Some people see members of the royal family as privileged idlers. He believes that adolescents who grow up in households with no rules become shambolic idlers incapable of organizing their lives.
More examplesFewer examplesAll his life, he had the reputation of being something of an idler.Idlers everywhere shudder with fear each time the Government launches a new health drive.There's no denying that Baudelaire was a scrounging idler and a hopeless wreck.
